questiontext.text:
Solve the following matrix multiplication for A (using inverse):

$$\small BA = I$$

where $$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}2 &9 \\12 &16\end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

and $$\small I = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 \\0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\:$$

a11 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-0.21053:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}a12 ={1:NUMERICAL:=0.11842:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
a21 ={1:NUMERICAL:=0.15789:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}a22 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-0.026316:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(2)(16) - (9)(16)}\begin{bmatrix}16 &-9 \\-12 &2 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}-0.21053 &0.11842 \\0.15789 &-0.026316 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =-0.21053$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =0.11842$$
$$\small a_{21} =0.15789$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =-0.026316$$

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(2)(20) - (6)(20)}\begin{bmatrix}20 &-6 \\-11 &2 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}-0.76923 &0.23077 \\0.42308 &-0.076923 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =-0.76923$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =0.23077$$
$$\small a_{21} =0.42308$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =-0.076923$$

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-1)(-16) - (-10)(-16)}\begin{bmatrix}-16 &10 \\12 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.15385 &-0.096154 \\-0.11538 &0.0096154 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.15385$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.096154$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.11538$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.0096154$$

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-1)(-16) - (-9)(-16)}\begin{bmatrix}-16 &9 \\15 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.13445 &-0.07563 \\-0.12605 &0.0084034 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.13445$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.07563$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.12605$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.0084034$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-4)(-20) - (-6)(-20)}\begin{bmatrix}-20 &6 \\14 &-4 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}5 &-1.5 \\-3.5 &1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =5$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-1.5$$
$$\small a_{21} =-3.5$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =1$$

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(4)(20) - (-6)(20)}\begin{bmatrix}20 &6 \\14 &4 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}-5 &-1.5 \\-3.5 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =-5$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-1.5$$
$$\small a_{21} =-3.5$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =-1$$
